posts.post_content:
This is probably one of the worst cards in the set. Proliferate gimmicks aren't worth it, and otherwise it's 8 mana for 9 life over 3 turns. There are *far* more efficient ways to do that. It probably does more as a metalcraft enabler than it does as a defensive card.  
  
That's the problem with dedicated life gain cards like this. If they make them too good, they'll break multiplayer games in half and turn them into drawn-out battles of attrition. Therefore, they become terrible in any *other* context.
posts.html:

That's the problem with dedicated life gain cards like this. If they make them too good, they'll break multiplayer games in half and turn them into drawn-out battles of attrition. Therefore, they become terrible in any other context.

posts.post_content:
I don't understand why people don't like this card. If this was a white card, then you guys might have a point. But the fact is that all artifacts have an increased mana cost because any deck can use it. Right now this card is rated 1 star. I could think of hundreds of cards strictly worse than this.  
  
This card will never see constructed play, but I just know that some Johnny out there will do something awesome with it in their casual deck. I'll give this card a fair rating of 2/5.
